document.text:
From: 
"-
To: "'Miller, Michael"' 
Cc: 
"Scavelli, Michael" 
Subject: RE: U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) 
Date: Thu, 18 Jul 2019 01:18:22 +0000 
>, "Martin G. Weinberg" < 
, "Weingarten, Reid" 
Mike, 
Regarding the conference tomorrow, we don't currently expect to make any arguments based on new facts, but we will 
respond to any questions from the Court as appropriate. 
We will make best efforts to bring the passport, if we're able to do so and if chain custody can be maintained. In any 
event, you are free to schedule a time with us to review the passport and any other physical evidence that has been 
collected. 
From: Miller, Michael < 
Sent: Wednesday, July 17, 2019 108 PM 
To: 
Cc: 
'; 
Martin G. Weinberg 
<M
>:   
•  Scavelli, Michael 
>; 
Weingarten, Reid <
= 
Subject: RE: U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) 
Thank you, Much appreciated. 
Quick question —  are there any facts or arguments that you envision making tomorrow that are not contained in 
your written submissions? 
Mike 
Michael C. Miller 
Partner 
Steptoe 
Steptoe & Johnson LLP 
1114 Avenue of the Americas I New York, NY 10036 
www.steptoe.com 
This message and any attached documents contain information from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP that may be confidential andfor privileged. If you 
are not the intended recipient, please do not read. copy, distribute, or use this information. If you have received this transmission in error, please notify the 
sender immediately by reply e-mail and then delete this message. 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, July 17, 2019 7:02 PM 
To: Miller, Michael 
Cc: 
EFTA00021571

Martin G. Weinberg 
Scavelli, Michael •  Weingarten, Reid 
Subject: U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) 
Mike, 
The photographs you requested are attached. My understanding is that pages 6 and 7 were blank, and were not 
photographed. 
Best, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
New York, NY 10007 
EFTA00021572
